å¤´æ˜çš„å‰å®³ï¼Œæœ‰äº›éŸ³ä¹å’Œåœºæ™¯æœ‰ç‚¹å“äººï¼ˆå¯èƒ½æ˜¯å› ä¸ºæˆ‘èƒ†å°ï¼‰ï¼Œå…¶å®ƒå‡ ä¹éƒ½æ˜¯å®Œç¾çš„
Legendary and revolutionary game, with a unique story. Icon of all gaming.

I needed some time to process this game.

As on of the people that didn't get into gaming for a long time, when I played this game fully it took me a while to beat.

If you want to play an expertly crafted singleplayer game that has defined an entire genre... yea... you get the rest of the story.

Every part of Half Life 2 works incredibly well due to how much effort was put into it's physics engine, the Source engine. Honestly, it works so well, and is so fun despite the tone for most of the game.

Yes it has flaws, but the game was just a ton of fun to experience and experiment with. Despite it being made in 2004, it isn't all that dated outside of graphics, and even then, it doesn't look bad to look at.

Frankly if you haven't played it by now, i'm impressed. Buy it anyway, you won't regret it.
gordon

There's a pretty good reason people see this game as a landmark in the history of the medium. It's hard-hitting, it's got an engaging and well-told story, and there's great variety in the gameplay department. For the longest time I didn't really get the whole waiting for Half-Life 3 meme, but if there's any series where we need to see the next entry, it's this one.

It's half-life 2.

At least a 9.2/10

This game is one of the greatest games out there if not the greatest game ever made. This is a sequel done right. The story is phenomenal, and the mechanics are amazing. This was the first game I ever bought on steam and I'm glad I did because there is nothing else like this out there. You will not regret buying this game and you will never get tired of it. It is a crime against humanity if you haven't played this game and whoever says that this game was bad should be declared legally insane.

I'm 16 years too late to the party
